alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 24 at 2:42PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, McDonald. * WHEN...Until 800 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 PM CDT, Big Sugar and Little Sugar creeks remain in minor flood stage from last nights rainfall however water levels are beginning to decrease - This includes the following low water crossings... Honey Creek at Highway 43, Butler Creek at Kings Highway, Big Sugar Creek at Buzzard Glory Road, Little Sugar Creek at Skaggs Hollow Road, Honey Creek at Oak Street and Bentonville Hollow at Highway E. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pineville, Anderson, Noel, South West City, Lanagan, Dodge, Cayuga, Powell, Tiff City and Big Sugar Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
